org.rsna.ctp.stdstages.storage

Class FileSystemManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rsna.ctp.stdstages.storage.FileSystemManager

  • public class FileSystemManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to keep track of FileSystems.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected FileSystemManager(java.io.File root, java.lang.String type, boolean requireAuthentication, boolean acceptDuplicateUIDs, boolean setReadable, boolean setWritable, java.io.File exportDirectory, java.util.List<ImageQualifiers> qualifiers)
      Create an empty table of FileSystems based on a specific root directory.

      Get the singleton instance of the FileSystemManager for a specific root directory.
      int getSize()

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileSystemManager

        protected FileSystemManager(java.io.File root,
                 java.lang.String type,
                 boolean requireAuthentication,
                 boolean acceptDuplicateUIDs,
                 boolean setReadable,
                 boolean setWritable,
                 java.io.File exportDirectory,
                 java.util.List<ImageQualifiers> qualifiers)
        Create an empty table of FileSystems based on a specific root directory.
        Parameters:
        root - the directory within which all FileSystems are to be created.
        type - the structure to be imposed on study directories in the FileSystems managed by this FileSystemManager. See the Javadoc for the FileSystem constructor.
        requireAuthentication - true if accesses to FileSystems associated with this root require authentication; false otherwise.
        setReadable - true if files and directories in this root are to be world readable.
        setWritable - true if files and directories in this root are to be world writable.
        exportDirectory - the directory into which to copy files during an export copy operation or null if export copying is not configured.
        qualifiers - the list of qualifiers for the creation of JPEG images when a DICOM image is stored.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static FileSystemManager getInstance(java.io.File root,
                            java.lang.String type,
                            boolean requireAuthentication,
                            boolean acceptDuplicateUIDs,
                            boolean setReadable,
                            boolean setWritable,
                            java.io.File exportDirectory,
                            java.util.List<ImageQualifiers> qualifiers)
        Get the singleton instance of the FileSystemManager for a specific root directory. This method returns a new FileSystemManager of the specified type if a FileSystemManager cannot be found for the specified root directory.
        Parameters:
        root - the directory managed by the FileSystemManager. See the Javadoc for the FileSystem constructor.
        type - the directory structure to be imposed on FileSystems in this root.
        requireAuthentication - true if accesses to FileSystems associated with this root require authentication; false otherwise.
        setReadable - true if files and directories in this root are to be world readable.
        setWritable - true if files and directories in this root are to be world writable.
        exportDirectory - the directory into which to copy files during an export copy operation or null if export copying is not configured.
        qualifiers - the list of qualifiers for the creation of JPEG images when a DICOM image is stored.

      • getInstance

        public static FileSystemManager getInstance(java.io.File root)
        Get the singleton instance of the FileSystemManager for a specific root directory. This method returns null if a FileSystemManager cannot be found for the specified root directory. This method should be used by servlets which are only interested in files which actually exist.
        Parameters:
        root - the directory managed by the FileSystemManager.

      • getFileSystemsFor

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFileSystemsFor(org.rsna.server.User user)
        Get all the FileSystems for a specified User and return them all in a List.
        Parameters:
        user - the user requesting access.
        Returns:
        a list of all the FileSystems.

      • getExportDirectory

        public java.io.File getExportDirectory()
        Get the export directory configured for this FileSystemManager.
        Returns:
        the export directory.

      • getFileSystems

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFileSystems()
        Load all the FileSystems managed by this FileSystemManager and return them all in a List.
        Returns:
        a list of all the FileSystems.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Get the number of FileSystems managed by this FileSystemManager This method calls getFileSystems to ensure that all FileSystems have been loaded.
        Returns:
        the number of FileSystems.

      • getFileSystem

        public FileSystem getFileSystem(java.lang.String name)
        Get the named FileSystem, creating it if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the FileSystem to be loaded. Note: the name is filtered by the static FileSystem.makeFSName() method, so the FileSystem.getName() method may return a different name from the one in this method call.
        Returns:
        the FileSystem with the specified name.

      • getFileSystem

        public FileSystem getFileSystem(java.lang.String name,
                       boolean create)
        Get the named FileSystem. If no FileSystem exists with the specified name, create it and add it to the table only if the create boolean is true.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the FileSystem to be loaded. Note: the name is filtered by the static FileSystem.makeFSName() method, so the FileSystem.getName() method may return a different name from the one in this method call.
        create - true if the FileSystem is to be created if it does not exist; false if null is to be returned if the FileSystem does not exist.
        Returns:
        the FileSystem with the specified name.
